page.title: 12Land around Tattenhoe
page.content: We went to visit Tattenhoe Church. We had to go down a very long muddy lane,through a gate and along a path in a field to get to the little church. There are no houses near the church, but there are two cottages out on the lane.At the end of the lane was a big house which was Tattenhoe Hall. The church is in the middle of a field which is full of sheep.Near the church. there are several moats which are very old. In the grave yard there were four graves,three were the Clarke family and one grave had the name of Monk on it. The dates on the graves were between 1910 and 1914. We felt very isolated standing by the church but we could see the ring road going from Bletchley to Milton Keynes in the distance.
